intro: Aspidistra subrotata subsp. crassinervis, commonly known as the broad-veined aspidistra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves with prominent, parallel veins. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense clumps over time.
